title: Provides that towers, including communications towers, may not be erected on special parkway lands without the consent of the local government
summary: Provides that towers, including communications towers, etc., may not be erected on special parkway lands (Westchester county) without the consent of the local government in which located and must comply with all local laws, regulations, etc.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2429

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the transportation law, in relation to the erection of certain
towers on special parkway lands

PURPOSE:
This bill prohibits the commissioner of transportation to grant any
erection of communication towers/cell towers on special parkway lands
without the consent of the local government in which such lands are
located. This bill prohibits the commissioner of transportation to
grant any erection of communication towers/cell towers on special
parkway lands without the consent of the local government in which
such lands are located.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends the transportation law by adding a new section 71-a that states
the commissioner shall not erect, cause or permit to be erected,
grant easements or licenses for, or facilitate the erection of any
tower on special parkway lands, including cellular/PCS towers,
without the consent of the local government in which such lands are
located. This shall conform in all respects to any and all local
laws, ordinances, resolutions, rules, and regulations.

"Special Parkways" are parkways located in Westchester County,
including the Hutchinson River Parkway, the Saw Mill River Parkway,
the Cross County Parkway, the Taconic Parkway, and the Sprain Brook
Parkway.

JUSTIFICATION:
In cases where the State determines communication towers, including
cell towers, are to be erected on special parkway lands, it should
recognize the traditional role of local governments as purveyors of
land use policy. This can only be accomplished by requiring consent
from the applicable local government be granted to the State before
allowing such permanent and readily observable towers to be erected.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
04/24/09 REFERRED TO TRANSPORTATION
01/06/10 REFERRED TO TRANSPORTATION

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
